oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pickard Family Performance P-12-B & Dec. 6
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tape 4 of 7. Two recordings of the Pickard Family (performance group) from December 6, of an unknown year, at 9:00 and December 6, of an unknown year, at an unknown time respectively. Sessions are recorded in Mexico.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pickard Family
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) All Aboard for Tennessee (Pickard Family) -- (00:17) Ruthie and Charlie Pickard joke about the jug and sing a quick line -- (01:19) Long, Long Ago (Pickard Family) [Featuring Obed Pickard Vocals] -- (03:45) Obed jokes about good news coming up -- (04:13) [Unidentified Fiddle Tune] (Pickard Family) -- (06:10) Ruthie and Charlie introduce "Let the Rest of the World Go By" and Obed and Bub comment (07:08) Let the Rest of the World Go By (Charlie and Ruthie Pickard) -- (08:59) Tell Mother I'll be There (Pickard Family) -- (11:32) Turkey in the Straw (Pickard Family) -- (12:32) Charlie and Ruthie talk about Thanksgiving and tell a story of making a turkey the national bird -- (13:25) Railroad Boomer (Pickard Family) -- (16:27) Obed and Ruthie talk about yodeling songs -- (17:00) [Unidentified Instrumental Tune] -- (17:23) Obed, Charlie and Ruthie joke about the jug and Harmonic Al -- (18:47) Way Down Upon the Sweanee River (Pickard Family) [Featuring Charlie vocal] -- (21:04) Ruthie and Charlie talk about a letter addressed to Charlie (21:23) It's the Old Songs that Live Forever (Pickard Family)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Pickard Family (Musical Group);
